metadata.synopsis: Shadowheart reacts to taking offerings made at a shrine to Selûne, the rival of her goddess Shar. If Shadowheart is the avatar, she has a moment of introspection where she considers if she should take the items of not. If Shadowheart is a companion, she encourages the player to not take the items. The player can try talk her around, and may discover she is a Shar worshipper if they don't already know. The outcome of this dialogue potentially strengthens or damages Shadowheart's opinion of the player.

47.speaker: Shadowheart
47.text: You should leave it. Or even destroy it, if possible.
47.context: InternalNodeContext: Companion Origin is speaker 1, Avatar is speaker 2

49.speaker: Player
49.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

76.speaker: Shadowheart
76.text: This rubbish is an offering to Selûne. At best, it's worthless. At worst... who knows? Could be cursed.
76.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

55.speaker: Shadowheart
55.text: Do not trifle with that moon witch or her trinkets. Only trouble will follow.
55.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

96.speaker: Player
96.text: Why do you care so much?
96.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

14.speaker: Shadowheart
14.text: I should've just stayed quiet. You want the truth? Fine.
14.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

4.speaker: Shadowheart
4.text: I should've just stayed quiet. You want the truth? Fine.

33.speaker: Shadowheart
33.text: I worship Shar, Mistress of the Night - Selûne's twin and foe.

38.text: Because we've enough troubles and burdens as it is. Common sense, that's all.
38.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

102.speaker: Shadowheart
102.text: Because we've enough troubles and burdens as it is. Common sense, that's all.
102.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

60.speaker: Player
60.text: You're hiding something. You worship Shar, don't you?
60.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

73.speaker: Shadowheart
73.text: ... I should have been more discreet around you, clearly. Yes, you're right.
73.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

29.speaker: Shadowheart
29.text: Don't make a fuss, Selûnite - we may be at odds, but I have more important concerns than you right now.
29.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

72.speaker: Shadowheart
72.text: The goddess of secrets? How telling.
72.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

5.speaker: Lae'zel
5.text: The goddess of secrets? How telling.
5.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

22.speaker: Shadowheart
22.text: I'll decide whether to make a fuss or not. Hard to trust someone who's holding out on me.
22.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I'll decide whether to make a fuss or not. Hard to trust someone who's holding out on me.
0.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

43.speaker: Shadowheart
43.text: Secrecy is everything for Shar's children. It's our code, our creed, our shield.
43.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

84.speaker: Shadowheart
84.text: I even keep secrets from myself - I had my memories suppressed, so that nothing I knew could be used against the Dark Lady. Once I prove myself, my memories will be restored.
84.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

37.speaker: Shadowheart
37.text: I'm not sorry I kept this from you. Not one bit.

44.speaker: Shadowheart
44.text: Though perhaps that might change, if you can show an open mind.
44.context: NodeContext: Conceding jus a little towards the player's hurt feelings - but conditionally

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Let's see how open-minded I can be then: tell me more.

31.speaker: Shadowheart
31.text: Talk to me later. We've got more pressing matters to see to right now.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: We can discuss this later. But let's just try a little more honesty going forward.

89.speaker: Shadowheart
89.text: All we can do is try, I suppose...

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I don't know how I feel about this.

45.speaker: Shadowheart
45.text: Who says you have to feel anything?

3.speaker: Shadowheart
3.text: Gather your thoughts. Then perhaps we can talk some more.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Don't make a big fuss...? You've been lying to me!
95.context: NodeContext: A little embarassed at being thanked

81.speaker: Shadowheart
81.text: A lie of omission at most. I'm sure you have some skeletons of your own hidden away.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: You could have told me. How long were you going to keep this secret?
10.context: NodeContext: A little embarassed at being thanked

79.speaker: Shadowheart
79.text: Forever, ideally. And you assume too much about what I can and cannot tell.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I didn't agree to join up with a Shar worshipper.
65.context: NodeContext: A little embarassed at being thanked

77.speaker: Shadowheart
77.text: Then it's your own fault for not asking.
77.context: NodeContext: A little embarassed at being thanked

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Now that the truth's out, tell me more.
13.context: NodeContext: A little embarassed at being thanked

17.speaker: Player
17.text: It's been some time since I met another faithful of Shar. Are you versed in her teachings?
17.context: NodeContext: A little embarassed at being thanked

68.speaker: Shadowheart
68.text: Of course I am. But we can talk about this later - let's go.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: In future, I expect you to be honest. Let's leave it at that for now.
46.context: NodeContext: A little embarassed at being thanked

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Thank you for telling me, at least.
86.context: NodeContext: A little embarassed at being thanked

11.speaker: Shadowheart
11.text: Don't thank me - I'm breaking Lady Shar's teachings just by doing so... but sometimes you have to be practical.
11.context: NodeContext: A little embarassed at being thanked

28.speaker: Player
28.text: I can't trust you. Best if we travel separately for now.

94.speaker: Shadowheart
94.text: If you insist. Don't expect to fare well without me to save you.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I don't care who you worship. We have bigger problems.

56.speaker: Shadowheart
56.text: True. I didn't think you'd react so pragmatically. Perhaps I should have told you sooner.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Shar is an abomination. You deceived me.

42.speaker: Shadowheart
42.text: Your blindness as much as my deception, Selûnite. We can talk about this later - if you're willing.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: I bow to Shar also. The Dark Lady must favour us, to have brought us together.

66.speaker: Shadowheart
66.text: I... yes, she must. I'll offer thanks to her in my prayers - and we should speak more later. Alone, ideally.

64.speaker: Karlach
64.text: Fantastic. Monsters in our minds, and around our campfire.

99.speaker: Astarion
99.text: Heavens forbid. We're all entitled to our secrets.

103.speaker: Wyll
103.text: A Shar worshipper? Not my usual quarry - nor my usual ally.

6.speaker: Gale
6.text: You worship Shar? Blimey. She and my beloved Mystra are not exactly friends.

106.speaker: Shadowheart
106.text: Now that you have the truth, please don't make a big fuss about it.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: There's more. Use your parasite and enter her thoughts. Look for what she's hiding.

98.speaker: Shadowheart
98.text: *She's repelled by the Selûnite relics. They are an offence to her goddess - Shar.*

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *She's repelled by the Selûnite relics. They are an offence to her goddess - Shar.*

7.text: Agh - I can feel you, idiot. Keep out of my skull or I'll break yours open.

19.speaker: Shadowheart
19.text: Agh - I can feel you, idiot. Keep out of my skull or I'll break yours open.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I'll do as I please. If you want to try stopping me, be my guest.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: We can't just abandon resources that we might need. Be sensible.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: That's twice you've spoken ill of my goddess. Watch your mouth.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: That's my patron goddess you're besmirching. Watch your mouth.

1.speaker: Shadowheart
1.text: You were just about to loot this shrine - don't pretend you're offended now.

78.speaker: Shadowheart
78.text: I almost pity her, if you're the quality of follower she attracts.

91.speaker: Shadowheart
91.text: Trifling with that moon witch will only bring you trouble. Shar's guidance is clear.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I'll do as I please. If you want to try stop me, be my guest.

105.speaker: Shadowheart
105.text: Fine. Perhaps you can sell them for a couple of coins.

67.speaker: Shadowheart
67.text: Fine. Perhaps you can sell them for a couple of coins.

24.text: Take them if you must. But I'll remember you didn't listen to sense.

35.speaker: Shadowheart
35.text: Take them if you must. But I'll remember you didn't listen to sense.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: We're in no position to abandon resources. I'm sure Shar will understand.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: No, this is perfect. You get to spite Selûne by stealing gifts meant for her.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: I decide what gods I heed. Not you.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Watch your mouth, Sharran. That's twice you've spoken ill of my goddess.

40.speaker: Shadowheart
40.text: Spare me the indignity - you looked set to loot this sad little shrine.

101.speaker: Shadowheart
101.text: I never knew Selûne's followers were quite so wretched. Do as you please.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: That's my patron goddess you're besmirching. Watch your mouth, Sharran.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: If it matters that much to you, I'll leave it.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Don't be ridiculous - there could be something useful here.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: These are offerings to Selûne. I won't destroy them.

83.speaker: Shadowheart
83.text: But you'll steal them? An interesting way to show your devotion.

57.speaker: Shadowheart
57.text: I do. Thank you for understanding.

53.speaker: Narrator
53.text: *You look at the Selûnite offerings. Nothing but profane baubles.*

90.speaker: Narrator
90.text: *Still, they could be traded for something valuable.*

41.speaker: Shadowheart
41.text: Taking them is the pragmatic choice.

27.speaker: Narrator
27.text: *But would Shar agree? Would she see it as accepting Selûnite gifts? Difficult to say.*

97.speaker: Shadowheart
97.text: To even touch that filth would be to dishonour Shar.

93.speaker: Narrator
93.text: *But would Shar agree? She may be pleased to see offerings to Selûne stolen. Difficult to say.*

87.speaker: Narrator
87.text: *You look at the Selûnite offerings. Nothing but profane baubles.*

71.speaker: Narrator
71.text: *Still, they could be traded for something valuable.*

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *But would Shar agree? Would she see it as accepting Selûnite gifts? Difficult to say.*
